title: Nvidia earnings beat drives AI rally across Nasdaq
content: Nvidia posted another earnings beat with strong data center growth, helping QQQ-heavy mega caps rally. Analysts said cloud capex remains strong and semiconductor demand could expand into the second half.

title: US retail sales miss raises soft-landing questions
content: US retail sales came in below expectations, triggering mixed performance in cyclical sectors. Dividend and quality names outperformed while growth multiples compressed briefly.

title: Fed officials signal rates likely unchanged near term
content: Multiple Fed officials highlighted progress on inflation and suggested rates could stay unchanged in the near term. Treasury yields stayed stable and broad market ETFs traded flat.

title: Energy shares fall as crude drops below key level
content: Oil prices fell after inventory data surprised to the upside, pressuring energy producers. Sector ETFs saw a broad drop and analysts cut short-term profit forecasts.

title: Healthcare innovation names upgrade on strong pipeline
content: Several large-cap healthcare companies received analyst upgrades after strong trial readouts. Defensive growth exposure attracted steady inflows from balanced ETF strategies.

title: Mega-cap tech faces valuation debate after sharp surge
content: After a sharp rally, strategists debated stretched valuation in mega-cap tech. Some desks warned of short-term pullback risk despite solid medium-term earnings growth.

title: Dividend ETFs see inflows as volatility ticks higher
content: With volatility rising, investors rotated into dividend ETFs for income stability. Fund flow data showed SCHD-related strategies attracting consistent allocations.

title: Cloud software guidance mixed; market reaction contained
content: Cloud software guidance was mixed this quarter. While some firms beat expectations, others cut outlooks. QQQ components ended mostly unchanged with dispersion under the surface.
